column2: Tsar (King) Nicholas II of the Russian Empire was overthrown because people were unhappy with their living conditions
column3: especially during World War I. The new government in Russia was a democratic socialist government. Unfortunately
column5: and people were still unhappy. In November 1917
column6: a communist group called the Bolsheviks led by Vladimir Lenin overthrew the new government. They were supported by groups of workers called Soviets. The Bolsheviks created a new communist government called the Russian Soviet Federative Socialist Republic (called simply Soviet Russia or the Russian SFSR).However
column7: not everyone supported the communists. Many countries that had been a part of the Russian Empire had left
column12: and Finland. The Russian Civil War began
column13: with the Russian SFSR's "Red Army" fighting against the "White Army"
column14: the group of all Russians against the communists. The White Army was not very united or organized. The Allied Powers of World War I
column18: invaded Russia to support the White Army.
